newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhs to hold tenders for gas line, refinery.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhs to hold tenders for gas line, refinery.

text.p: Kazakhstan will hold tenders on November 1 for several oil and gas enterprises, a senior property official told a news conference on Wednesday.
State Property Committee chairman Sarybai Kalmurzayev said one tender would be to manage sections of the country's gas pipeline transport system for 10-15 years.
The tender covers links in western Kazakhstan and hooking into the Russian and Central Asian systems, he said, but gave no further details.
Kazkommertsbank deputy chairman Askar Alshinbayev said Gaz de France, Enron Oil and Gas Co of the U.S. and Argentina's Bridas Energy Corp would probably bid.
The bank is the government's financial consultant.

Alshinbayev said the former Soviet republic would also hold a tender on November 1 for the Atyrau Oil Refinery (one of three Kazakh refineries), the Embaneft Oil Company and other unnamed energy enterprises.
Kazakhstan has blazed ahead in selling off oil and gas enteprises to Western investors through tenders or management contracts.

The oil-rich country is attracting billions of dollars for its on- and offshore hydrocarbon reserves. Oil reserves in Kazakhstan's Caspian Sea continental shelf are estimated at 10 billion tonnes (over 70 billion barrels).
